|Formatted as `hh:mm:ss`| |status| | |When the record is present in old OFP versions but not in the new OFP version then set to "CANCELLED" else set to "ACTIVE".| # Flight Plan Runway Data Model ### Data Retrieval #### - Data Retrieval Scope * :paperclip: Flight Plan Data Retrieval #### - Source Directory * :paperclip: Flight Plan Data Retrieval #### - Data Retrieval Trigger & Steps * :paperclip: Flight Plan Data Retrieval #### - Data Handling Operation * `legId` is retrieved from the RiverX Flight Leg Data Model using the values mapped according to the following conditions; * `ATCFlightPlan.xml.` = Flight Leg Data Model `udor` * `ATCFlightPlan.xml.` = Flight Leg Data Model `carrier` * `ATCFlightPlan.xml.` = Flight Leg Data Model `flightNumber` * `ATCFlightPlan.xml.` = Flight Leg Data Model `suffix` * `ATCFlightPlan.xml.` = Flight Leg Data Model `departureAirport` * `ATCFlightPlan.xml.` = Flight Leg Data Model `arrivalAirport` * Flight Leg Data Model `statusCode` <> “CNL“ and “DEL“ * When records exist in the Flight Plan Runway Data Model for the `legId` being processed from the Operation Flight Plan file, the `status`(see Mapping for details) of the associated Runways' records is updated to “CANCELLED” for the corresponding `legId`. * When Unique Key is null, `status`(see Mapping for details) of the associated Flight Plan Runways' records are updated as "CANCELLED" for corresponding `legId`. #### - Change Data Capture Operation * Unique Key: A composite key, combining `legId`, `stationIataCode` and `type` fields. * Insert and
